meanings.definition: A portable kit or equipment designed to be carried by a person on their back.
meanings.sent1: The hiker carried a manpack filled with supplies for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's manpack contained essential items for the mission.
meanings.sent3: Carrying his manpack, the explorer felt like a modern-day adventurer.
meanings.sent4: Her manpack was a treasure trove of tools and resources for survival.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the manpack on his back reminded him of the importance of preparation.

meanings.definition: To carry or transport equipment in a backpack.
meanings.sent1: They manpack their gear when hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She manpacks her laptop and books for school every day.
meanings.sent3: He decided to manpack his snacks for the road trip.
meanings.sent4: Manpacking his belongings, he set off on the trail.
meanings.sent5: Remember to manpack your essentials before heading out on the journey.

meanings.definition: A person who carries a backpack.
meanings.sent1: The manpack helped distribute the weight evenly on the hiker's shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The student with the colorful manpack stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The manpack in the group always had the snacks everyone craved.
meanings.sent4: Being a manpack for the team, he was responsible for carrying the supplies.
meanings.sent5: The manpack was always prepared for any situation that arose during the hike.
